result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary Robert Cataract was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Pepin County Case No. 2016CM20 Count 1

miscConds.notes: Bond be applied to costs with balance stayed for 4 months on condition of defendant obtaining an occupation or regular drivers license.  If occupational or regular drivers license obtained within the 4 months, remaining costs will be waived.

No violations of law.
No contact with victim.

timeConds.notes:
Serve 30 days in the Pepin County Jail and stayed on condition of completing 80 hours of community service.
AMENDED 02-06-2017:  Stay revoked, defendant to serve 30 days jail for violation of the community service program.
Concurrent with: Count 1 in Pepin County Case No. 2016CM20

Referred to Buffalo-Pepin Counties Criminal Justice Coordinating Council for completing 80 hours of community service.
AMENDED 02-06-2017:  Community service terminated for failure to comply with the program.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Sex with Child Age 16 or Older
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gary Robert Cataract

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Received notice from DOC that defendant paid court ordered obligations in full less his supervision fees.
Probation review hearing on July 24, 2017 at 01:15 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Gary Robert Cataract in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to lift the stay of jail for failure to comply with community service and serve the 30 days.  Court grants the revocation of the stay, defendant to report to jail to serve his 30 days.  Court inquired if defendant got his D/L.  Defendant has not.  Court orders defendant to pay the costs.  P&P Agent requests he be given huber for sex offender treatment.  Court grants request.

Probation review hearing on February 6, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Motion hearing on February 6, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Lift Stay
Probation review hearing on January 23, 2017 at 02:15 pm.

Buffalo-Pepin Counties CJCC Termination of C/S.  Buffalo-Pepin Counties CJCC Termination of C/S for failure to comply with the program.  The defendant has not completed the assigned community service.
Referred to Buffalo-Pepin Counties Criminal Justice Coordinating Council for completing 80 hours of community service.

Defendant Gary Robert Cataract in court with attorney Gary E. Smith.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties recommend probation with imposed & stayed jail sentence with c/s option.  Court withholds sentence and places defendant on 1 year probation concurrent with eachother with condition:  no violation of law; 30 days in PCJ & stay on condition of performing 80 hours c/s; pay costs of $443 in 16CM16 and stay for 4 mos. on condition get ODL or regular license; if don't get the license pay the $443; 16CM20 waive costs based on ability to pay; apply bond in 16CM12 on costs in 16CM16.  Affirm dismissed 16CM12, 16CM20 count 2.  Advised of appeal rights.  Case recalled, victim present, State reads her statement.  Court adds no contact with victim as condition of probation.

Defendant Gary Robert Cataract in court with attorney Gary E. Smith.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases not on calendar today.  Plead last time but didn't sentence.  Defendant previously plead to Domestic DC 2016CM20; State inadvertently filed OAR and he plead guilty; that should be dismissed & plea withdrawn.  Court dismisses 16CT19.  Set other 2 cases for sentencing.  State moves to dismiss 16CM12.  Court dismisses 16CM12.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 20, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Defendant Gary Robert Cataract in court with attorney Gary E. Smith.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement reached, after pleas, counsel to schedule sentencing date.
Defendant Gary Robert Cataract in court with attorney Gary E. Smith.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for July 19, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant Gary Robert Cataract in court with attorney Gary E. Smith.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NGP entered.  Status conference scheduled for July 5, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Gary Robert Cataract in court with attorney Gary E. Smith.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel requests 1 more adjournment.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 21, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Gary Robert Cataract in court with attorney Gary E. Smith.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court confirms defendant received copy of criminal complaint, advises of charge/max. penalties and rights.  State requests $1000 Sign. Bond with no contact with M.J.B.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
